# cosmic: create bundled lua distribution

Consolidates `spawn` and `walk` modules into a new `cosmic` namespace and creates a standalone `cosmic` binary that bundles lua with commonly-used libraries.

## Changes

- `lib/cosmic/` - new module namespace with `spawn.lua`, `walk.lua`, `init.lua`, `help.lua`
- `lib/cosmic/cook.mk` - build rules for cosmic binary bundling lua + luaunit + argparse + lfs
- Refactored all imports from `require("spawn").spawn` to `require("cosmic.spawn")` (callable pattern)
- Removed lazy loading from `init.lua` - users must explicitly require submodules
- Removed `lib/spawn/` and `lib/walk/` (consolidated into cosmic)
- `lib/home/cook.mk` - installs cosmic-lua in home binary
- `.github/workflows/release.yml` - includes cosmic-lua in release assets

## Usage

```lua
local spawn = require("cosmic.spawn")
local ok, out = spawn({"ls", "-la"}):read()

local walk = require("cosmic.walk")
local files = walk.collect(".", "%.lua$")
```

Build with `make cosmic`.

## Validation

- [x] All imports updated to use cosmic.spawn/cosmic.walk
- [x] Callable pattern works: `spawn({...})` instead of `spawn.spawn({...})`
- [x] Explicit imports required (no lazy loading)
- [x] cosmic-lua bundled in home binary
- [x] cosmic-lua included in release workflow
- [x] `make test check` passes
